thread.title: Iran's Rouhani asks EU to stand against U.S. 'illegal and illogical' actions: IRNA

title: Iran's Rouhani asks EU to stand against U.S. 'illegal and illogical' actions: IRNA
text:
May 15, 2018 / 10:48 AM / Updated 4 minutes ago Iran's Rouhani asks EU to stand against U.S. 'illegal and illogical' actions: IRNA Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
LONDON (Reuters) - Iranian President Hassan Rouhani asked the European Union to stand against the United States’“illegal and illogical” actions, saying that after Washington’s withdrawal from the nuclear deal, Tehran could stay in the accord only if it fully benefits from it. FILE PHOTO: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani attends a meeting with Muslim leaders and scholars in Hyderabad, India, February 15, 2018. REUTERS/Danish Siddiqui/File Photo
“Iran can stay in the JCPOA (the nuclear deal) only if it fully benefits from the deal,” Rouhani was quoted as saying by the state news agency IRNA on Tuesday. Reporting by Bozorgmehr Sharafedin; Editing by Alison Williams
